_prev_prog_3.Description:
This ammonia refrigeration process consists of only one unit thus we are not required to complete in detail the description section for this portion of the RMP.

In summary, the Process Safety Management Program is a major part of the Risk Management Program in place at the Keane Refrigerated Logistics Facility. This program is on-going and continual improvement is a primary objective.

Process ID #1 had been shut down for a period of time before Keane Refrigerated Logistics, LLC aquired ownership. Prior to bringing the process back on line a complete review of applicable design and safety standards was performed. A preventative maintenance program was initiated and all system components were  addressed.

The process safety program was developed following guidelines referenced in the OSHA General Industry Standards 29 CFR 1910.119 ??A? ??A?Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals??A? and Environmental Protection Agency Standard 40 CFR part 68, ??A?Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions??A?. Other sources of information referenced included but were not limited to standards and recommendations available from the International Institute for Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) and American Society of Heating Refrigeration and Air Conditioning (ASHRAE). This program is well established and continual improvements are encouraged and anticipated.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Executive Summary



Keane Refrigerated Logistics, LLP is a public cold storage facility and logistics service organization located at 24 Frontier Drive, West Deer Township, Allegheny County, PA.  The facilities primary business is the short and long term storage of food products prior to distribution to grocery stores.



The refrigeration process used to maintain cooler temperatures utilizes anhydrous ammonia (R717) as the refrigerant.  Anhydrous ammonia is widely used as refrigerant in many industrial facilities, including, meat, poultry, and fish processing facilities; dairy and ice cream plants; fruit  juice, vegetable juice, and soft drink processing facilities; and cold storage warehouses.  The refrigerant serving as the heat transfer fluid is circulated thru a closed loop system.



Keane Refrigerated Logistics is committed to operating cold storage facilities under conditions that are safe to employees, contractors, tenants, and the surrounding community.  The senior managements is committed to this cause.  As a result, the Safety Policy will be considered on an equal basis with productivity, efficiency, quality improvement, environmental issues and other policies developed by the Group.  To satisfy this core objective, the senior management team includes a member professionally trained to manage facility Safety and Risk Management Programs.



The core of the facilities overall approach to safe operation of the ammonia refrigeration system focuses a hazard assessment program, employee and contractor training, an ongoing preventative maintenance program, and an emergency response program.  We use a variety of safety equipment and strict procedures to prevent releases and to reduce the impact of releases should they ever occur.  Some examples include:



*  Regular and Routine Process Hazard Analysis.

*  Regular checklist audits of safety programs and records.

*  Emergency release training with employee trained first responders and the fire department.

*  Plant security:  locks, lights,j alarms, fencing, video surveillance, and warning signs.

*  Investigatiion of all incidents to improve our procedures.

*  Annual review and certification of standard operating procedures.



The EPA requires all companies to report the release of hazardous materials.  Keane Refrigerated Logistics has had no releases of ammonia in the last five years.  While some accidents may occur, we take great pride in our safety record and make every effort to ensure that they will be small and as infrequent as possible.



Employees of both Keane Refrigerated Logistics and its tenants have been trained specific to emergency response, HAZCOM (RTK) and Emergency Evacuation.



Emergency Response Training has been initiated and is an on-going program.  .



The West Deer VFW #3 Station 290 is located within two miles of the facility.  The Fire Chief and the local volunteer fire response team have inspected the facility conducting a walk thru and are prepared to assist and properly respond to an emergency situation should one occur.



Future plans for the on-going Risk Management program include routine preventative maintenance of mechanical refrigeration systems. We also intend to continuously focus on employee development and training specific to  safe operation of plant equipment, emergency response and employee evacuation.
